snippet.textDisplay:
No prob. Colette has a special attack too btw.

In the Japanese PS2 version every character has a hi-ougi, but they had to cut them out of the english ver. because of the GCN disk capacity or some other reason (they cut out other side-quests, boss battles, and costumes, too!)
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: P.S. technically you don't need a fire weapon, but you have to have the "Garnet" equipped (Efreet drops it) to make your weapon fire-based.
snippet.textOriginal: P.S. technically you don't need a fire weapon, but you have to have the "Garnet" equipped (Efreet drops it) to make your weapon fire-based.

snippet.textDisplay:
For R. Phoenix, you need to use R. Falcon 200 times, then equip a fire weapon to use it.

Falcon's crest is Lloyd's mystic arte/hi-ougi (these attacks are returning in ToS2!) which needs the following conditions to be met:
- you need the Eternal Swordsman title on
- have the material blade equipped
- Llyod's health has to be in the red zone
- then press X, A, B at the same time.
snippet.textOriginal:
For R. Phoenix, you need to use R. Falcon 200 times, then equip a fire weapon to use it.

Falcon's crest is Lloyd's mystic arte/hi-ougi (these attacks are returning in ToS2!) which needs the following conditions to be met:
- you need the Eternal Swordsman title on
- have the material blade equipped
- Llyod's health has to be in the red zone
- then press X, A, B at the same time.

snippet.textDisplay:
It was a great game. It started a bit slow when you have to follow the path of the Chosen or even when you have to form all the pacts with the Summon spirits, but the story really picked up afterwards.
Most of the characters were likable and the battle system was really fun. The ending left me wanting more. :P Good thing ToS2 is coming out on Wii!
snippet.textOriginal:
It was a great game. It started a bit slow when you have to follow the path of the Chosen or even when you have to form all the pacts with the Summon spirits, but the story really picked up afterwards.
Most of the characters were likable and the battle system was really fun. The ending left me wanting more. :P Good thing ToS2 is coming out on Wii!
